unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Language Spoken at Home: Finding a Probability
question_text:
According to U.S. Census reports (2009-2013), $20.7\%$ of individuals age $5$ and over reported that they “sometimes or always spoke a language other than English at home”. Suppose that this percentage has not changed.
If six individuals over the age $5$ are selected at random, what is the probability that at least one would report that they sometimes or always speak a language other than English at home?
